message.content:
<<<api>>>: BufferedReader.readLine()
<<<code>>>: 
public RecordManager(){
    int pos;
    String athlete, record, country, raceTime;
    try {
        BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("resultdata.txt"));
        String line;
        while((line = br.readLine()) != null){
            Scanner sc = new Scanner(line).useDelimiter("#");
            athlete = sc.next();
            country = sc.next();
            pos = sc.nextInt();
            record = sc.next();
            raceTime = sc.next();
            sc.close();
            if("WRC".equals(record)){
                resultArr[size] = new WorldRecord(athlete, country, pos, raceTime);
            }
            else if("OLR".equals(record)){
                resultArr[size] = new OlympicRecord(athlete, country, pos, raceTime);
            }
            else{
                resultArr[size] = new RaceResult(athlete, country, pos, raceTime);
            }
            size++;
        }
        br.close();
    } catch (FileNotFoundException ex) {
        Logger.getLogger(RecordManager.class.getName()).log(Level.SEVERE, null, ex);
    } catch (IOException ex) {
        Logger.getLogger(RecordManager.class.getName()).log(Level.SEVERE, null, ex);
    }
}

<<<explanation>>>: The issue with your code is that you are using `Scanner` to read the file, which is causing the `NoSuchElementException` error. To fix this, you can use `BufferedReader.readLine()` to read the file line by line. This method reads a line of text from the input stream and returns it as a `String`. You can then use `Scanner` to parse the line and extract the required data. Additionally, make sure to close the `BufferedReader` after you have finished reading the file.
